translations.translation: Man has only to look at his food.
Let man therefore consider (the sources of) his food.
So let man just consider his food:
Let the human being think about (how We produce) his food.
So man must look at his food.
Then let man look at his food:
Then let man look to his food,
Let Man consider his nourishment.
Let man consider his food:
Let man reflect on the food he eats.
Let man look at his food:
Let man consider his food:
Then let man look at his food, (and how We provide it):
Then let man look at his food,
Let the human reflect on the food he eats,
Let man consider his food.
Then let mankind look at his food -
[80:24] So let man consider, in reflection, his [source of] food, how it is determined and procured for him:
(Let man consider his food) let the disbelieving person, 'Utbah Ibn Abi Lahab, think about the food he eats, how it is transformed from state to state until it reaches him to eat:

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلإِنسَانُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ } معناه إلى مَدخلِهِ ومخرجِهِ
 فَجعلَ ذَلكَ لَهم آيةً

translations.translation:
And His saying, {So let man look at his food}, means to look at his entrance and his exit.


He made that a sign for them

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
وبالجملة: { فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلإِنسَانُ } المجبول على الكفران والنسيان { إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ } [عبس: 24] المسوق له من لدنَّا تفضلاً وتكريماً
 لتقويته وتقويم بنيته
